Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: glazed (fired brown and only traces remaining); exterior: painted decoration consists of two rays rising from narrow band; band on outside of foot; underside: three narrow concentric bands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.241) (phase 3)
